abstract: According to a recent study by Ernst & Young, 36 percent of companies plan to pursue an acquisition in 2012.
lead_paragraph: Before Europe's debt crisis flared anew last summer, rattling markets and choking off a revival in mergers and acquisitions, huge corporate cash piles and cheap debt had fostered hopes that deal-making would recover strongly last year.

headline.main: On Wall Street, Renewed Optimism for Deal-Making
